results.title: Ballad of Lucy Jordan
results.brief_description: Animated adaptation of the song by Dr. Hook, using mainly photographic stills to tell the sad and ironic tale of a thirty seven year old house wife whose daydreams lead only to despair.

results.title: Astronauts and jellybeans
results.creator_credit: Dan Bessie, Severo Perez and Learning Garden
results.brief_description: Animation and live action are used to outline the development of the spoken and written language, beginning with the earliest diagrammatic and pictorial forms of communication. Notes the importance of the written word, the use of the dictionary, and the sound of words.

results.title: We are of the soil
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau and Iowa State University Film Production Unit
results.brief_description:
Highlights the consequences of erosion due to wind, water and overworking of the soil, as well as outlining some possible erosion control techniques. Also considers with whom the responsibility for control of soil erosion lies.
Suitable for middle and uppeer secondary levels.

results.title: The Eye: an inside story
results.brief_description: Reveals the various parts of the eye and the functions of each part, as well as showing the mechanics of this complex organ and how the phenomenon of vision is accomplished. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Blood: composition and functions
results.brief_description: Microphotography shows three cellular components of the blood and their functions. Time-lapse photography clearly indicates coagulation and fibrin formation; and the manufacture of cells in bone marrow from primitive cells is examined. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Herald newsreel
results.brief_description: One of the first sound films produced in Australia, this newsreel shows Joe Lyons, Prime Minister 1931-1939, and his Cabinet giving a message for Britain and the sister dominions, after swearing in at Government House. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Naming the federal capital of Australia: the ceremony
results.brief_description: Newsreel footage of the ceremonies surrounding the naming of Canberra on 12 March 1913 including scenes of Capital Hill, Andrew Fisher, Billy Hughes, the Light Horse Brigade and the laying of the various foundation stones. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Simple organisms: Bacteria (Revised)
results.brief_description: Looks at the discovery of bacteria and examines their structure and means of feeding. Binary fission and antibiotics are examined, as are some uses of bacteria, nitrogen fixing, cheese making and chemical manufacture.
